comment:
Represents a Notes item containing file data encoded as CD records in base64 format. 
		
This is the representation used in &quot;note format&quot; DXL (which is also the fallback for design elements without a descriptive representation).
constructorsignature: Public Sub New(parent As FileResource, elnote As NotesDOMElementNode, itemname As String)
commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Represents a Notes item containing file data encoded as CD records in base64 format. <br />		<br />This is the representation used in &quot;note format&quot; DXL (which is also the fallback for design elements without a descriptive representation).</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
commenthtml: Represents a Notes item containing file data encoded as CD records in base64 format. <br />		<br />This is the representation used in &quot;note format&quot; DXL (which is also the fallback for design elements without a descriptive representation).
inlinecomment:
' Represents a Notes item containing file data encoded as CD records in base64 format. 
		
This is the representation used in &quot;note format&quot; DXL (which is also the fallback for design elements without a descriptive representation).

methods.label: FindFileResource
methods.comment:
Search a database for a design element of a given name and type (type being, for instance, &quot;xpage&quot; or &quot;stylesheet&quot;). 
		
This is only suitable for design elements of the type that contain binary-encoded file data, which is usually but not always in an item named $FileData.
NOTE: This has the same drawback as NotesDatabase.GetView and the like, in that if there are multiple design elements with the same name you will only find one of them.  It may be better to use NotesNoteCollection to locate the design elements yourself and call MakeFileResource instead.
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Search a database for a design element of a given name and type (type being, for instance, &quot;xpage&quot; or &quot;stylesheet&quot;). <br />		<br />This is only suitable for design elements of the type that contain binary-encoded file data, which is usually but not always in an item named $FileData.<br />NOTE: This has the same drawback as NotesDatabase.GetView and the like, in that if there are multiple design elements with the same name you will only find one of them.  It may be better to use NotesNoteCollection to locate the design elements yourself and call MakeFileResource instead.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Search a database for a design element of a given name and type (type being, for instance, &quot;xpage&quot; or &quot;stylesheet&quot;). <br />		<br />This is only suitable for design elements of the type that contain binary-encoded file data, which is usually but not always in an item named $FileData.<br />NOTE: This has the same drawback as NotesDatabase.GetView and the like, in that if there are multiple design elements with the same name you will only find one of them.  It may be better to use NotesNoteCollection to locate the design elements yourself and call MakeFileResource instead.

' Search a database for a design element of a given name and type (type being, for instance, &quot;xpage&quot; or &quot;stylesheet&quot;). 
		
This is only suitable for design elements of the type that contain binary-encoded file data, which is usually but not always in an item named $FileData.
NOTE: This has the same drawback as NotesDatabase.GetView and the like, in that if there are multiple design elements with the same name you will only find one of them.  It may be better to use NotesNoteCollection to locate the design elements yourself and call MakeFileResource instead.

methods.label: MakeFileResource
methods.comment: Given the NotesDocument handle of a design element (which you&apos;ve probably found using NotesNoteCollection), creates a FileResource object representing that design element. Note this is only suitable for use with design elements of the &quot;file resource&quot; type.
methods.signature: Public Function MakeFileResource(docDes As NotesDocument) As FileResource
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Given the NotesDocument handle of a design element (which you&apos;ve probably found using NotesNoteCollection), creates a FileResource object representing that design element. Note this is only suitable for use with design elements of the &quot;file resource&quot; type.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Given the NotesDocument handle of a design element (which you&apos;ve probably found using NotesNoteCollection), creates a FileResource object representing that design element. Note this is only suitable for use with design elements of the &quot;file resource&quot; type.

methods.label: Load
methods.comment:
Populate the Stream object with the decoded contents of the file.
			
Note you can assign Stream first with your own object, if you want to store the result in a file. Note that nothing is said here about character set; you data are treated as binary. If you supply a stream that&apos;s attached to a file, you can specify the character set when you open the file. 
		
Otherwise, if you need to read the contents as character data, see StreamToText function (not method!).
			
If you supply a stream, it will be truncated.
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Populate the Stream object with the decoded contents of the file.<br />			<br />Note you can assign Stream first with your own object, if you want to store the result in a file. Note that nothing is said here about character set; you data are treated as binary. If you supply a stream that&apos;s attached to a file, you can specify the character set when you open the file. <br />		<br />Otherwise, if you need to read the contents as character data, see StreamToText function (not method!).<br />			<br />If you supply a stream, it will be truncated.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Populate the Stream object with the decoded contents of the file.<br />			<br />Note you can assign Stream first with your own object, if you want to store the result in a file. Note that nothing is said here about character set; you data are treated as binary. If you supply a stream that&apos;s attached to a file, you can specify the character set when you open the file. <br />		<br />Otherwise, if you need to read the contents as character data, see StreamToText function (not method!).<br />			<br />If you supply a stream, it will be truncated.
methods.inlinecomment:
' Populate the Stream object with the decoded contents of the file.
			
Note you can assign Stream first with your own object, if you want to store the result in a file. Note that nothing is said here about character set; you data are treated as binary. If you supply a stream that&apos;s attached to a file, you can specify the character set when you open the file. 
		
Otherwise, if you need to read the contents as character data, see StreamToText function (not method!).
			
If you supply a stream, it will be truncated.

methods.label: New
methods.comment: Arguments are the parsed DOM node of the element representing a design element, and the name of the composite item you would like to read, modify or create.
methods.argumentsuffix: (parent As FileResource, elnote As NotesDOMElementNode, itemname As String)

methods.label: UpdateFile
methods.comment: Take binary file data as input, and create or update the &lt;item&gt; element to store that data as CD records. The streamIn buffer must contain only the data to be written (current position in the stream is ignored).
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Take binary file data as input, and create or update the &lt;item&gt; element to store that data as CD records. The streamIn buffer must contain only the data to be written (current position in the stream is ignored).</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
